intro: Canscora sanjappae, commonly known as the Sanjappa's Canscora, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
